sen.j: 藤森駅（ふじのもりえき）は、京都府京都市伏見区深草キトロ町にある、京阪電気鉄道京阪本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Fukakusa-kitoro-cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Fujinomori Station is a stop on the Keihan Main Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.
Fujinomori Station, located in Fukakusa-kitoro-cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Keihan Main Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.
Fujinomori Station, located in Fukakusa-kitoro-cho, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Keihan Main Line, which is operated by Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station Layout
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 相対式2面2線ホームを持つ地上駅。
sen.e: It is located on the ground level, with two parallel platforms serving two tracks between them.
It is located on the ground level, with two parallel platforms serving two tracks between them.
It is located on the ground level, with two parallel platforms serving two tracks between them.

sen.j: 駅舎（改札口）は淀屋橋方面ホーム側にあり、反対側の出町柳方面ホームへは改札内の地下道で連絡している。
sen.e: The station house (entrance/exit gate place) is located on the side of the platfrom used by the trains for Yodoyabashi, and an underground path is provided inside the entrance/exit gate place to go to the other platform used by the trains for Demachiyanagi.

The station house (entrance/exit gate) is located on the side of the platform used by the trains bound for Yodoyabashi, and an underground path is provided within the entrance/exit gate to go to the other platform used by the trains bound for Demachiyanagi.

The station house (ticket gate) is located on the side of the platform used by the trains bound for Yodoyabashi, and an underground path is provided within the ticket gate to go to the other platform used by the trains bound for Demachiyanagi.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: 駅の北側に地下自由通路があり、駅西側へと通じている。
sen.e: An free undergraound path is provided on the northern side of the station, enbling access to the west side of the station.
An free underground path is provided on the north side of the station, enabling access to the west side of the station.
An free underground path is provided on the north side of the station, enabling access to the west side of the station.

sen.j: また、出町柳方面ホームは淀屋橋方面ホームより北側へ数両分ずれて設置されており、ホームをオーバークロスするかたちで名神高速道路が通っている。
sen.e: The platfrom used by the trains for Yodoyabashi is placed in several train-car length north from the position where the platform used by the trains for Demachiyanagi is located, and an overpass of Meishin Expressway is placed over and across the platforms

The platform used by the trains for Yodoyabashi is located several train-car lengths north from the position where the platform used by the trains for Demachiyanagi is located, and an overpass of Meishin Expressway is placed over and across the platforms.

The platform used by the trains for Yodoyabashi is located several train-car lengths north from the position where the platform used by the trains for Demachiyanagi is located, and an overpass of Meishin Expressway is placed over and across the platforms.

sen.j: 1980年代半ばより、駅名にちなんでホームの柱を薄紫（藤色）に塗っている。
sen.e: Since around the mid-1980s, the pillars of the platforms have been painted pale purple corresponding to the station name.
Since around the mid-1980s, the pillars of the platforms have been painted pale purple, corresponding to the name of the station.
Since around the mid-1980s, the pillars of the platforms have been painted pale purple, corresponding to the name of the station (Fuji means wisteria in Japanese).
sen.cmt: 藤 の説明を追加しました。

sen.e: Platforms
Platforms
Platforms

sen.j: ※両ホームとも有効長は8両（但し停車する列車は7両のみ）。
sen.e: * Both lengths of the platforms are that for eight train cars (however, only seven-car train stop actually).
* Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate an eight-car train (but only seven-car trains stop there).
* Each platform has a length sufficient to accommodate an eight-car train (but only seven-car trains stop there).

sen.j: 駅舎のすぐ東側を琵琶湖疏水が流れており、1928年に竣工された歩行者専用の堀田橋が架けられている。
sen.e: The Lake Biwa canal flows on the immediate east side of this station house and Hotta-bashi Bridge dedicated for pedestrian use was constructed over the canal in 1928
The Lake Biwa Canal flows on the immediate east side of this station house, and Hotta-bashi Bridge--which is dedicated for pedestrian use--was constructed over the canal in 1928.
The Lake Biwa Canal flows on the immediate east side of this station house, and Hotta-bashi Bridge--which is dedicated for pedestrian use--was constructed over the canal in 1928.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1910年（明治43年）4月15日 師団前駅として開業。
sen.e: April 15, 1910: This station started its opration as Shidan-mae Station.
April 15, 1910: This facility started operating as Shidan-mae Station.
April 15, 1910: This facility started operating as Shidan-mae Station.

sen.j: 1941年（昭和16年）9月1日 藤森駅に改称。
sen.e: September 1, 1941: Its name was changed to Fujinomori Station.
September 1, 1941: Its name was changed to Fujinomori Station.
September 1, 1941: Its name was changed to Fujinomori Station.

sen.j: （師団所在地であるため防諜上の理由）
sen.e: With a miritary division ("shidan" in Japanese) was stationed nearby, the change of the name was a conterespionage purpose.)
With a military division ("shidan" in Japanese) stationed nearby, the change of the name was for the purpose of counterespionage.
With a military division ("shidan" in Japanese) stationed nearby, the change of the name was for the purpose of counterespionage.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: October 1, 1943: The companies concerned merged and this station became a station of Keihanshin-kyuko-dentetsu (Hankyu Corporation).
October 1, 1943: The companies concerned merged, and this station became a facility of Keihanshin-kyuko-dentetsu (Hankyu Corporation).
October 1, 1943: The companies concerned merged, and this station became a facility of Keihanshin Express Electric Railway (Hankyu Corporation).
sen.cmt: 京阪神急行電鉄→Keihanshin Express Electric Railway としました。

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）12月1日 会社分離により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: December 1, 1949: Due to a separation of the company, this station became a station of Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Due to a separation of the company, this station became a facility of Keihan Electric Railway.
December 1, 1949: Due to a separation of the company, this station became a facility of Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 1977年（昭和52年）3月30日 駅の西側に京阪電鉄初の分譲マンション「ローズマンション藤の森」の分譲開始。
sen.e: March 30, 1977: The sale of "Rose Mansion Fujinomori," the first condominium apartment built by Keihan Electric Railway, started on the west side of this station.
March 30, 1977: The sale of "Rose Mansion Fujinomori," the first condominium apartment built by Keihan Electric Railway, started on the west side of this station.
March 30, 1977: The sale of 'Rose Mansion Fujinomori,' the first condominium apartment built by Keihan Electric Railway, started on the west side of this station.

sen.j: 1978年（昭和53年）3月30日 「ローズマンション藤の森」竣工、京阪藤の森ビル竣工。
sen.e: March 30, 1978: The construction of "Rose Mansion Fujinimori " was completed and that of the Keihan Fujinomori building was also completed.
March 30, 1978: The construction of "Rose Mansion Fujinimori " was completed, as was that of the Keihan Fujinomori building.
March 30, 1978: The construction of 'Rose Mansion Fujinomori ' was completed, as was that of the Keihan Fujinomori building.
sen.cmt: " → ' としました。Fujinomori に修正しました。

sen.j: 1999年（平成11年）3月29日 大阪行きホームに車椅子用スロープ設置。
sen.e: March 29, 1999: Slopes for wheel chairs were provided for the platform for the trains for Osaka.
March 29, 1999: Slopes for wheelchairs were provided for the platform for the trains bound for Osaka.
March 29, 1999: Slopes for wheelchairs were provided for the platform for the trains bound for Osaka.

sen.j: 2003年（平成15年）「二代目おけいはん江本理恵」のCM撮影に使われる。
sen.e: 2003: Pictures for the "second-generation Okeihan, Rie EMOTO"commercial were taken at this station.
2003: Pictures for the "second-generation Okeihan, Rie EMOTO"commercial were taken at this station.
2003: Pictures for the 'second-generation Okeihan, Rie EMOTO' commercial were taken at this station.

sen.j: 2008年（平成20年）2月 ホーム異常通報装置設置
sen.e: February, 2008: Equipment for informing abnormalities on a platform was installed.
February, 2008: Equipment to indicate any abnormality on a platform was installed.
February, 2008: Equipment to indicate any abnormality on a platform was installed.

sen.j: 2000年頃までは車内放送の際に駅名の後に「科学センター前」と呼称していた。
sen.e: Until around 2000, an announcement of "Kagaku Center-mae (in front of the Science center)" was made following the announcement of the station name in the public address system of the train.
Until around 2000, an announcement of "Kagaku Center-mae (in front of the Science Center)" was made following the announcement of the station's name in the public address system on the train.
Until around 2000, an announcement of 'Kagaku Center-mae (in front of the Science Center)" was made following the announcement of the station's name in the public address system on the train.

sen.j: さらに以前においては日本急行バスへの乗換を案内していた時期がある（その時期には「科学センター前」の呼称はなし）。
sen.e: For some time before that era, an announcement informing how to get on buses of Nihon Kyuko Bus (日本急行バス)(the Japan express bus) from this station was made (in this era, the announcement of "Kagaku Center-mae (in front of the Science center)" was not made).

For some time before that era, an announcement indicating how to get on buses of Nihon Kyuko Bus (日本急行バス) (the Japan express bus) from this station was made (in this era, the announcement of "Kagaku Center-mae (in front of the Science Center)" wasn't made).

For some time before that era, an announcement indicating how to get on buses of Nihon Kyuko Bus (日本急行バス) (the Japan express bus) from this station was made (in this era, the announcement of 'Kagaku Center-mae (in front of the Science Center)' wasn't made).

sen.j: この時期には各ホームに乗り換えを示す電照看板、改札近傍に電照看板の時刻表もあった。
sen.e: In this era, a light-illuminated board displaying information for riding the buses was placed on each platform and a light-illuminated bus time table board was also placed around the entrance/exit gate place.
In this era, a light-illuminated board displaying information for bus passengers was placed on each platform and a light-illuminated bus timetable board was installed near the entrance/exit gate.
In this era, a light-illuminated board displaying information for bus passengers was placed on each platform and a light-illuminated bus timetable board was installed near the ticket gate.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: 名神ハイウェイバスのうち、日本急行バスには京阪も出資していたことが、（他の事業者を無視する形で）このような案内を行っていた理由と考えられる。
sen.e: Of the Meishin highway bus companies, Nihon Kyuko Bus was partly funded by Keihan, and it is considered to be a reason whey such information specific to Nihon Kyuko Bus was given at the station (neglecting activities of other highway bus companies).

Of the Meishin highway bus companies, Nihon Kyuko Bus was partly funded by Keihan, which is considered to be a reason such information specific to Nihon Kyuko Bus was given at the station (in neglect of the activities of other highway bus companies).

Of the Meishin highway bus companies, Nihon Kyuko Bus was partly funded by Keihan, which is considered to be a reason such information specific to Nihon Kyuko Bus was given at the station (in neglect of the activities of other highway bus companies).

sen.j: その後、1971年に日本急行バスが名鉄資本に一本化され、さらに1979年には運行が名鉄傘下の名古屋観光自動車に委託されたことから案内は取りやめられた。
sen.e: Later, Nihon Kyuko Bus became to be totally funded by Meitetsur in 1971, then its operation was entrusted to Nagoya Kanko Jidosha (the Nagoya sightseeing car company), and the announement of the buses was discontinued.

Later, in 1971, Nihon Kyuko Bus became totally funded by Meitetsur, whereupon its operation was entrusted to Nagoya Kanko Jidosha (the Nagoya sightseeing car company), and the announcement of buses was discontinued.

Later, in 1971, Nihon Kyuko Bus became totally funded by Meitetsu, whereupon its operation was entrusted to Nagoya Kanko Jidosha (the Nagoya sightseeing car company) in 1979, and the announcement of buses was discontinued.
sen.cmt: Meitetsu に修正しました。1979を追加しました。

sen.j: 2008年3月に京都市との合同で西改札口の設置・改札階と上下ホームを結ぶエレベーターの設置の整備計画を発表された。
sen.e: In March, 2008, Keihan Electric Railway and Kyoto City jointly announced a plan to construct a west side entrance/exit gate place and also to install an elevator connectiing the floor of each entrance/exit gate place with the corresponding platform.

In March, 2008, Keihan Electric Railway and Kyoto City jointly announced a plan to construct a west-side entrance/exit gate and install an elevator connecting the floor of each entrance/exit gate with the corresponding platform.

In March, 2008, Keihan Electric Railway and Kyoto City jointly announced a plan to construct a west-side ticket gate and install an elevator connecting the floor of each ticket gate with the corresponding platform.
sen.cmt: 改札口→ticket gate としました。

sen.j: 完成は2010年度の予定。
sen.e: The construction and instalation is scheduled to be completed in the fiscal 2010.
The construction and installation are scheduled for completion in fiscal 2010.
The construction and installation are scheduled for completion in fiscal year 2010.
